channel.title: Linda's Digital Garden on
channel.description: Recent content in Linda's Digital Garden on

item.title: What I Talk About When I Talk About Running
item.description: Something that I really detest about myself is that I have gotten much worse at being alone. I have also gotten a lot worse at untangling the balls of uncertainty within me.

item.title: Folding Beijing
item.description: This book is pleasantly short, but it made me think about Yuval Noah Harari’s so-called ‘useless class.’ Harari argues that in the aftermath of the AI revolution, “just as mass industrialization created the working class, the AI revolution will create a new unworking class.

item.title: Submission
item.description: This book was a pain to get through. But something I’m learning is that you don’t have to understand every word to grasp a book.

item.title: The Closing of the American Mind
item.description: In The Closing of the American Mind, Allan Bloom presents a critique of the state of higher education in the United States, particularly elite liberal arts universities like Stanford.

item.title: De Amicitia
item.description: [[Cicero]] wrote De Amicitia at a pivotal point in his life and in history. He had spent a life devoted to Roman politics during the first century BC, a time of tremendous upheaval and civil war.

item.title: How Will You Measure Your Life
item.description: My classmates were not only some of the brightest people I’ve known, but some of the most decent people, too.

item.title: The Sun Also Rises
item.description: I feel pretty numb after reading this book. And I only read it because I was going to Paris, and I wanted my trip to Europe to be at least somewhat literary.

item.title: A Thousand Years of Good Prayers
item.description: I have been trying to finish Clay Christensen’s How Will You Measure Your Life because Mike from Floodgate raved about it.

item.title: Exhalation
item.description: Before diving in, some life updates first: I just moved to California last week. I think I like it here. The weather suits me.

item.title: The Hidden Girl
item.description: Yesterday, I went to a webinar featuring Ken Liu, in which he talked about the value of stories. According to Liu, stories are maps for what it means to live a good life, to be fully human.

item.title: Educated
item.description: I’ve been recommended this book at least three times now? First my prefect, then two friends from middle school. Even before that, I had seen Educated in every store and all over the internet since it came out in 2018.

item.title: AI Superpowers
item.description: I got my third recommendation for AI Superpowers a couple of weeks back (#iykyk), and conveniently had many copies lying around the house, so I decided to pick up this book.

item.title: Benchmark Pt. 1
item.description: Beginnings John Doerr and [[Kleiner Perkins]] [[John Doerr]] was the 800 pound gorilla in the VC ecosystem in the early 1990s and specifically leading up to and during the internet era.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Holiday Special 2022
item.description: [[Taylor Swift]] Why is it that Taylor Swift is bigger than the Beatles? She’s probably the first really, really big internet rockstar.

item.title: The Paper Menagerie
item.description: This book is stunning. It made me cry and laugh and think critically about who I am and what is my place in the world.
